channel.title: 667/711 server help
channel.description: Hello, Im not a coder, neither am I a programmer, Im just making a server for the fun of it and for me to play with my friends, so anyone who is going to help me, it is really appreciated :) Okay here's my problem, Im using the Disturbed files that I found in the downloads section, now Im making the server with hamachi and its running alright, but I want to know how to make a server with no-ip so that I won't need to get my friends to download hamachi and just makes everyone's life easier. I've already looked at the portforwarding tutorials but I don't really get what I exactly have to do, so can anyone explain it to me in details and say every step that I have to follow to get the server running on the ip made by no-ip? Thank you very much for your cooperation ^^

item.title: 667/711 server help
item.dc:creator: @ChatX2012 ChatX2012
item.description:
@ChatX2012 wrote:

Actually problem solved, I have the port open, and I have no-ip installed and Im hosting an ip, all of this is one computer with a router, now Im trying to run the client from another computer with a totally different router, and Im using the ip from no-ip, but the client is not loading, its stuck at 1%, although on the other pc it shows that my ip is trying to connect, help me please ^^

Read full topic

item.description:
@ChatX2012 wrote:

Hello, thank you a lot for that guide, I’ll try and implement what you’ve said and hopefully it will work, and I already do have team viewer, I’ll send you a message if I need help if you don’t mind

Read full topic

item.title: 667/711 server help
item.dc:creator: @Camballer Camballer
item.description:
@Camballer wrote:

Well first of all register on no-ip.com. Then make an ip for your server. Then you have to download the no-ip client and log in with your info and select the ip adress you made. After that you must portforward. You need the password to your router. There should be an option called forwarding or port forwarding. Look for that. (Connect to your router with 192.168.0.1 or with your ip adress, to get your ip adress go to ipchicken.com). Then when you see port forwarding you have to forward the port (43594) and you have to enter your ipv4 adress. To find your ipv4 adress open your cmd and type ipconfig then hit enter. After portforwarding you run the source, and you should have a client with your ip adress that you set so they can just run the client and log on. If you need any help download teamviewer.

Read full topic
